title: Tottenham confirm deal with Amazon over multi-million pound fly-on-the-wall documentary
text:
Tottenham Hotspur will become the latest side to feature in an Amazon Prime documentary after confirming a multi-million pound deal for their own series.

Sportsmail exclusively revealed back in September that Spurs were in advanced negotiations over a fly-on-the-wall documentary with Amazon following the success of an initial series with Manchester City.

In a slight deviation away from the City series, the documentary will focus more on the building of their new stadium, its impact on the local community in north London and the club's growing relationship with the NFL, who will stage two regular season games each year at Tottenham for the next 10 years.

Chairman Daniel Levy's Tottenham have opened doors to Amazon access for a documentary

Titled 'All Or Nothing: Tottenham Hotspur' it will take fans behind the scenes during the 2019-20 season and follow all of the key events.

The cameras will be inside their world-leading training facilities, their brand new epic 62,000-seater stadium and away from the pitch.

The docuseries will focus on the unique aspects of the club, including its extensive work and impact in helping to transform the local area.

As part of Amazon's deal with the club, there will be close-up access to the players and staff, including manager Mauricio Pochettino.

After following the north London side through this season, the series will launch exclusively on Prime Video next year in more than 200 countries and territories worldwide.

Spurs will become the second Premier League side to feature in an Amazon documentary following on from the initial 'All or Nothing' series with Manchester City
